channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Saudi investment chief warns: Global business needs cooperation, not protectionism
item.description: “In my view, no nation or company can achieve resilience [in] isolation,” said H.E. Khalid A. Al-Falih.

item.title: AIG to acquire the majority of renewal rights to Everest Group’s global retail insurance portfolio in $2 billion deal
item.description: The acquisition gives AIG access to future business without inheriting responsibility for claims and obligations predating the deal.

item.title: Jack DeJohnette, Revered Jazz Drummer, Dies at 83
item.description: Endowed with spectacular range, he played with Miles Davis, led New Directions and Special Edition, and spent decades with Keith Jarrett’s Standards T...

item.title: Trump’s China Deal May Avert a Crisis of His Own Making
item.description: The Trump administration is hailing a potential deal that may return the U.S.-China relationship to where it was before the president began a trade wa...

item.title: Qualcomm Unveils New Line of Chips to Join the A.I. Boom
item.description: Qualcomm, which is known for its chips in smartphones, also announced a deal with Humain, a Saudi-backed A.I. company. The news sent Qualcomm’s share ...

item.title: Candy inflation has spooked so many consumers almost 80% say they’re forced to scale back how much to buy for Halloween
item.description: Of the 6,000+ shoppers surveyed, 83% said they’re capping their candy spending at $100.

item.title: Police Investigate Possible Arson at Home of Portland City Councilor
item.description: The police said a fire that damaged cars and a carport at the home of City Councilor Candace Avalos was “suspicious in nature.” No arrests have been m...

item.title: The FOMO-fueled gold bubble may now be turning into a ‘mini-bust,’ analysts say
item.description: "The latest leg of the gold rally looks like a market bubble that is in its final stages."

item.title: A West Texas Children’s Clinic Where Vaccine Suspicion Is Encouraged
item.description: Parents who come to Pia Habersang’s practice in Amarillo shun vaccinations, with the encouragement of the clinic’s registered nurse; the health secret...

item.title: Open-source AI is ‘China’s game right now’—and that’s a problem for the U.S. and its allies, Andreessen Horowitz partner says
item.description: Andreessen Horowitz partner Anjney Midha says China is leading in open-source AI, driven by startups like DeepSeek, while the U.S. is playing catch-up...

item.title: Map: 6.0-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Turkey
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Live Updates: Hurricane Melissa Churns to Jamaica With 175 M.P.H. Winds and Catastrophic Rains

item.title: The U.N.’s food agency says cutbacks forced it to send fewer meals to storm zones.
Rebranding Immigration
item.description: India wants to send its vast work force abroad. It may have found a way around a word that stokes opposition in many countries.

item.title: Why Trump’s Asia Visit Is Consequential
